Title: Practice: image processing and analysis
Creator: Stefan Lang, University of Salzburg
Abstract: This introductory course in remote sensing and (satellite) image analysis covers the basic analysis workflow. It requires a lecture or any other introductory class in the theoretical fundamentals of remote sensing
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand remote sensing workflow including image acquisition, (pixel-based) image analysis, classification and validation; get to know online portals, data catalogues, and pricing schemes for satellite data; Familiarize with the European Copernicus Earth observation programme; Master standard image analysis routines as implemented in ArcGIS Pro

Title: Terrascope Application Development
Creator: VITO - Vlaamse Instelling voor Technologisch Onderzoek
Abstract: This slide set provides overview of how researchers or students could utilize Terrascope Jupyter notebooks and API such as openEO to develop remote sensing algorithms and applications
Contributors: Jeroen Dries, Tamas Banyai, Hande Erdem

Title: Terrascope
Creator: VITO - Vlaamse Instelling voor Technologisch Onderzoek
Abstract: This training material provides an overview of 'Terrascope', which is one of the EO platforms that are being used within EO4GEO project. With this material, you can familiarize yourself with Terrascope and learn how to access to the data and process it.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand different types of Copernicus satellite data and derived products available on Terrascope Platform; Understand different tools and methods that can be leveraged to access and process data
Contributors: Jurgen Everaerts, Hande Erdem, Jeroen Dries

Title: The EO4GEO project
Creator: Roderic Molina, GISIG
Abstract: This is a brief introductory presentation to the Erasmus+ EO4GEO project. EO4GEO is an Erasmus+ Sector Skills Alliance gathering 26 partners from 13 EU countries.EO4GEO aims to help bridging the skills gap in the space/geospatial sector by creating a strong alliance of players from the sector/community reinforcing the existing ecosystem and fostering the uptake and integration of space/geospatial data and services.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the main objectives and outcomes of the Erasmus+ EO4GEO project; Evaluate the strategic importance of the EO4GEO project in the context of the Copernicus programme;

Title: Urban Heat Islands
Creator: Veronika Krieger, Spatial Services GmbH
Abstract: This slideset is a tutorial for a basic analysis of urban heat islands. Within the tutorial SNAP, QGIS and eCognition are used.
Description: Learning outcomes: Interpret EO-derived temperature maps; Identify local heat islands; See how different land cover affects temperature; Understand how urban-scale weather/climate information may be usefully employed at urban management;

Title: Copernicus Service - Land
Creator: Andrija Krtalic, University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on Copernicus Services for land monitoring.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the Copernicus ecosystem and services; perform simple analysis with Jupyter Notebook; Understand Copernicus Climate Change Service;

Title: Copernicus Service - Land
Creator: Andrija Krtalic, University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on Copernicus Services for land monitoring.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the Copernicus ecosystem and services; perform simple analysis with Jupyter Notebook; Understand Copernicus Climate Change Service;

Title: Copernicus Service - Land
Creator: Andrija Krtalic, University of Zagreb, Faculty of Geodesy
Abstract: This is a lesson on Copernicus Services for land monitoring.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the Copernicus ecosystem and services; perform simple analysis with Jupyter Notebook; Understand Copernicus Climate Change Service;

Title: Classification: Random Forests
Creator: Mariana Belgiu, University of Twente
Abstract: Introduction to Random Forests
Description: Learning objective: explain the advantanges of Random Forests over Decision Trees; describe the sensitivity of Random Forests to hyperparameters

Title: Classification: Decision Trees
Creator: Mariana Belgiu, Faculty of Geoinformation Science and Earth Observation (ITC), University of Twente
Abstract: Decision Trees
Description: Learning objective: the overall goal of this learning unit is to explain how decision trees works

Title: Introduction to GIS
Creator: Anna Adamowicz, UNEP/GRID-Warsaw Centre
Abstract: This is an introductory course to GIS including basic information on: Geographic Information System, spatial data (raster and vector model), coordinate systems, attribute and spatial queries, simple analysis using geoprocessing tools, and data visualization.
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand the basic concepts of Geographic Information Systems; Define terms related to raster and vector data models (e.g. pixel, grid, spatial resolution, attribute table, topology); Compare vector and raster data models; Understand the difference between geographic and projected coordinate systems; Select objects using attribute and spatial queries; Perform simple analysis with geoprocessing tools; List map elements and basic principles of map creation; Create a thematic map using different methods of symbolization;

Title: Training module on SDI Architecture and SDI components
Abstract: Spatial data are widely used in public and private organisations. However, the data are often difficult to find, access, use and combine. Spatial data infrastructures (SDI) are a solution to this lack of accessibility and interoperability. An SDI is a set of technological and non-technological components meant to facilitate access, exchange and re-use of geospatial data within and between organisations.The module introduces the concept of SDIs and explains the rationale behind it. It explains the  different technical and non-technical components of an SDI: data, services, metadata, standards, technology, organisational and institutional aspects (people), etc. and how the technological components work together. The module discusses also what SDI are used for, i.e. what are the objectives of a good functioning SDI.. The components and the benefits of an SDI are illustrated using real world examples. The access to SDIs through geoportals is demonstrated. Learners will visit several geoportals and will learn to browse for data.The training material consist of presentations, exercises and supporting documents. The module is NOT a self-learning module, but needs class tutoring and interactions.
Description: Learning outcomes:To describe and explain the rationale and concepts of SDIs; To explain the requirements for building a successful SDI;to recognise and describe the different components of an SDI; To explain how these components work together in an SDI; To explain how geoportals are a user interface to SDIs and their specific functions; To identify the benefits of an SDI for her/his organisation; To search and find specific datasets

Title: Management view on SDI
Creator: Glenn Vancauwenberghe
Abstract: This module gives an overview of the non-technical aspects related to Spatial Data Infrastructures (SDI). In SDI several technical and non-technical components work together. This module focuses on the non-technical components and is targeting process owners and managers.
Description: Learning outcomes:Learning outcomes: Explain the main objectives of an SDI

Title: Sentinel-2 data and vegetation indices
Creator: Agata Hościło, Institute of Geodesy and Cartography
Abstract: This is a training material on Sentinel-2 data and vegetation indices
Contributors: Valerio Tramutoli, Nicola Capece, Valeria Satriano - University of Basilicata; Sara Wiman, Greger Lindeberg - Geografiska informationsbyrån;dc:created

Title: What is Copernicus?
Creator: Agata Hościło, Institute of Geodesy and Cartography
Abstract: This is a training material on Introduction to Remote Sensing containing the basic definitions, satellite data sources and brief description of Copernicus services with particular focus on the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service

Title: Change Detection Using EO Data
Creator: Ioana-Maria Vlad Sandru, Romanian Space Agency
Abstract: The text provide introductory concepts on detecting changes using EO data. Considerations about quantitative vs qualitative assessment as well as methods and processing steps are also provided
Description: Learning outcomes: Understand how EO satellite data can help detecting changes in different types of environment on Earth

Title: Foundamental of optical remote sensing
Creator: Valerio Tramutoli, University of Basilicata
Abstract: This is a module on Physical Principles which are the basis of any Remote Sensing application
Description: Understand Physical Principles which are the basis of Remote Sensing;

Title: Programación SIG en entornos Web
Creator: Carlos Granell, Universitat Jaume I de Castelló, Spain
Abstract: The programming course introduces the student the basics of the Leaflet library to create simple web-based maps
Description: Learning outcomes: Identify main components and functionality of Leaflet library; Describe Leaflet's main functions and how they are employed; Create a simple web-based map application

Title: Reproducibility Research in the Geosciences
Creator: Carlos Granell, Universitat Jaume I de Castelló, Spain
Abstract: In this course students will get an introduction to the main ideas and tools to acquire reproducible research practices
Description: Learning outcomes: Apply a series of practices (steps and tasks) for reproducible research in different phases of a project; Plan a reproducibility project independently; Recognize the importance of reproducible research as a fundamental pillar of modern science; Understand the problems associated with the lack of reproducibilitydc:contributor

Title: Object-based Image Analysis - An Introduction
Creator: Stefan Lang, University of Salzburg
Abstract: These slides provide an introduction to concepts and methods of Object-based image analysis. The slides have been prepared for and used in the virtual GEOBIA summer school in 2020.
Contributors: Eva Missoni, Barbara Hofer, Simon Donike
